Same thing here: you should raise a ValueError. Exception is too general (it is the base class of all Exceptions). Also, you should give the axis passed in the error message: ('Invalid axis in normalization: %r' % axis).

This is incompatible with joblib: in joblib it's negative values that give all the CPUs. -1 is all CPUs. -2 is all the CPUs but one... In recent versions of joblib, it actually raises an error for n_jobs=0, because it is meaningless.
